answer_html: Hence the system is consistent for all non-zero values of t.
answer_latex:
Hence the system is consistent for all non-zero values
of \emph{t}.
hints_html:
Writing this system in matrix form, what will tell you whether the system is consistent or not?

A linear system of three equations is consistent if it has a solution (x1, x2, x3).
hints_latex:
Writing this system in matrix form, what will tell you whether the
system is consistent or not?

A linear system of three equations is consistent if it has a solution
(\emph{x}\textsubscript{1}, \emph{x}\textsubscript{2},
\emph{x}\textsubscript{3}).
hints_raw:
Writing this system in matrix form, what will tell you whether the system is consistent or not?
A linear system of three equations is consistent if it has a solution (''x''<sub>1</sub>, ''x''<sub>2</sub>, ''x''<sub>3</sub>).
question: 1 (a)
sols_html:
We can write this system in matrix form:

\[\begin{aligned} \left[ \begin{array}{ccc} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 3 & 5+t \end{array} \right] \left[ \begin{array}{c} x_1 \\ x_2 \\ x_3 \end{array} \right] = \left[ \begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array} \right]\end{aligned}\]

To know if the system is consistent, we want to look at the row reduced form of the augmented matrix.

First, perform the operations L2 \(\rightarrow\) L2-L1 and L3 \(\rightarrow\) L3-2L1

\[\begin{aligned} \left[ \begin{array}{cccc} 1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & 3 & 5+t & 2 \end{array} \right] \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc} 1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 0 & -1 & -1 & 1 \\ 0 & -1 & -1+t & 0 \end{array} \right]\end{aligned}\]

Then, perform L2 \(\rightarrow\) (-1)L2

\[\begin{aligned} \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc} 1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & 1 & -1 \\ 0 & -1 & -1+t & 0 \end{array} \right]\end{aligned}\]

Perform L3 \(\rightarrow\) L3+L2

\[\begin{aligned} \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc} 1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & 1 & -1 \\ 0 & 0 & t & -1 \end{array} \right]\end{aligned}\]

If we read the last row of this matrix, we obtain the equation

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle tx_3 = -1\end{aligned}\]

The system is inconsistent if t = 0 since that would give us the equation 0 = -1. Hence the system is consistent for all non-zero values of t.
sols_raw:
We can write this system in matrix form:
:<math>
\left[ \begin{array}{ccc}
1 & 2 & 3 \\
1 & 1 & 2 \\
2 & 3 & 5+t
\end{array} \right] \left[ \begin{array}{c}
x_1 \\
x_2 \\
x_3
\end{array} \right] = \left[ \begin{array}{c}
1 \\
2 \\
2
\end{array} \right]
</math>

To know if the system is consistent, we want to look at the row reduced form of the augmented matrix.

First, perform the operations L<sub>2</sub> &rarr; L<sub>2</sub>-L<sub>1</sub> and L<sub>3</sub> &rarr; L<sub>3</sub>-2L<sub>1</sub>
:<math>
\left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
1 & 1 & 2 & 2 \\
2 & 3 & 5+t & 2
\end{array} \right]  \sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
0 & -1 & -1 & 1 \\
0 & -1 & -1+t & 0
\end{array} \right]
</math>
Then, perform L<sub>2</sub> &rarr; (-1)L<sub>2</sub>
:<math>
\sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & 1 & -1 \\
0 & -1 & -1+t & 0
\end{array} \right]
</math>
Perform L<sub>3</sub> &rarr; L<sub>3</sub>+L<sub>2</sub>
:<math>
\sim \left[ \begin{array}{cccc}
1 & 2 & 3 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & 1 & -1 \\
0 & 0 & t & -1
\end{array} \right]
</math>

If we read the last row of this matrix, we obtain the equation
:<math>\displaystyle
tx_3 = -1
</math>

The system is inconsistent if ''t'' = 0 since that would give us the equation 0 = -1. Hence the system is consistent for all non-zero values of ''t''.
statement_html:
Consider the system of equations in the variables x1, x2, x3:

\[\begin{aligned} &x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 &= 1\\ &x_1 + x_2 + 2x_3 &= 2\\ &2x_1 + 3x_2 + (5+t)x_3 &= 2\end{aligned}\]

Determine all the values of t for which the system is consistent.
statement_latex:
Consider the system of equations in the variables
\emph{x}\textsubscript{1}, \emph{x}\textsubscript{2},
\emph{x}\textsubscript{3}:

\begin{align*}
&x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 &= 1\\
&x_1 + x_2 + 2x_3 &= 2\\
&2x_1 + 3x_2 + (5+t)x_3 &= 2
\end{align*} Determine all the values of \emph{t} for which the system
is consistent.
statement_raw:
Consider the system of equations in the variables ''x''<sub>1</sub>, ''x''<sub>2</sub>, ''x''<sub>3</sub>:
:<math>
\begin{align}
&x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 &= 1\\
&x_1 + x_2 + 2x_3 &= 2\\
&2x_1 + 3x_2 + (5+t)x_3 &= 2
\end{align}
</math>
Determine all the values of ''t'' for which the system is consistent.
